title: Linear Algebra
description: Fundamentals of linear algebra with detailed explanations and examples.
markdownContent:
üìê Linear Algebra

Linear Algebra is a fundamental field of mathematics that deals with vector spaces, linear mappings, matrices, and their applications. It forms the basis for many areas of mathematics and its applications in natural sciences, engineering, and computer science.

Main Topics of Linear Algebra:

1. Vector Spaces

Basic algebraic structures with vectors and their operations.

  • Vectors and their properties
  • Linear combinations
  • Basis and dimension

2. Matrices

Rectangular arrangements of numbers and their operations.

  • Matrix operations
  • Special matrices
  • Matrix inversion

3. Linear Mappings

Structure-preserving mappings between vector spaces.

  • Definition and properties
  • Matrix representation
  • Kernel and image

4. Determinants

Important characteristics of square matrices.

  • Calculation
  • Properties
  • Applications

5. Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors

Characteristic values of linear mappings.

  • Eigenvalue problem
  • Diagonalization
  • Applications

Applications

Natural Sciences

  • Quantum mechanics
  • Vibration systems
  • Population dynamics

Engineering

  • Computer graphics
  • Signal processing
  • Control systems

Computer Science

  • Search engines
  • Machine learning
  • Cryptography
